intro: Schizobasis intricata, commonly known as the intricate schizobasis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, Schizobasis intricata is considered endangered and requires careful preservation efforts.
